More Service Cloud Features

Communicate with customers over email directly from the Service Console. Email-to-Case turns customer emails into cases for your support team.

Email-to-Case Limits and Limitations: keeps email traffic outside your network’s firewall and refuses emails that are too large.

Set Up Email-to-Case with a Guided Setup Flow: get cases into Service Cloud fast with a quick guided setup flow for Email-to-Case. Connect your support email address to Salesforce, give incoming cases a default priority and queue, and set up mail forwarding so emails become cases for your support team.

Email System Forwarding Guidelines: configure email forwarding correctly to attach emails and responses to related cases when customers send an email to a support address.

Email-to-Case Considerations: review considerations and limitations for Email-to-Case.

Threading: get to know email threading in Salesforce and learn how it helps track customer inquiries.

Email-to-Case Threading Limitations & Considerations: review Email-to-Case limitations and considerations related to email threading.
title: Setting up Email-to-Case in Salesforce Service Cloud
